We know that healthier pregnancies lead to healthier babies.

I was grateful for the opportunity today to hear directly from maternal health providers at @MFLDclinic on what more we can do to make sure Wisconsin women and their babies can get the health care they need. pic.twitter.com/RyjL5G5uoc

That’s why I worked to pass a bipartisan reform with @LisaMurkowski that would help identify areas that are lacking OB-GYNs and work to send maternity health care professionals to those areas to serve women in need. I was proud to see @POTUS sign my reform into law last year.

Twenty of Wisconsin’s 72 counties don’t have an OB-GYN. That means thousands of women have to either drive long distances to get the care they need, or in some cases may be forced to forgo that care entirely. That’s unacceptable to me and we need to fix it.

Today I visited the Marshfield Clinic Weston Center to meet with OB-GYNs, nurses and medical assistants about how we can improve access to maternity care in Wisconsin, and especially for women in rural communities. https://twitter.com/mfldclinic/status/1111713962440253441 …
